result.execSummary:
The defendant Hevenly Breeze Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for early discharge after 1 year, upon Agent's application.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment, or attend GED/HSED or its equivalent, or any combination of both.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

C: Defendant, DOC
Elements

Defendant Hevenly Breeze Wilson in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
15CF264 - no contest pleas to counts 3 & 4. 
15CM214 - no contest plea to count 2. 
15CM304 - no contest plea to count 2. 
14CM320 - DPA terminated. Guilty finding on count 1. 
15CM213 - no contest plea to count 2. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court for cases 15CF264, 15CM214, 15CM304 & 15CM213. 
Pleas accepted after rights explained and the defendant is found guilty. 
All remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
State is in compliance with victim notifications. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- submit to AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician 
- obtain/maintain full time employment, or attend GED/HSED, or any combination of both 
- 50 hours community service work 
- maintain absolute sobriety 
- eligible for early discharge, after 1 year upon Agent's application 
Appeal rights explained.
